revised_title: On Electrotorsion and its Effects on Iron Wires
tldr: The author investigates the phenomenon of electrotorsion, discovering that it causes torsional movements in iron wires accompanied by audible sounds. The study explores the effects of various materials and currents, concluding that the most probable cause of the torsion is the combined influence of longitudinal magnetic polarity and induced magnetism at a right angle to it, causing molecular motion and change in particle position.
